answers.answer: Call your doctor/midwife/l&d and let them know it could be something serious. Has the baby been active as normal, or has baby been less active?
That is a plus, but most of your symptoms sound serious and being so far along it is better to be checked out or even just ask.
Yeah you.might want to get your blood pressure checked. And I had a head he a.was vomiting before I went into labor..
Thanks for the tip ladies I will call my Dr. & see if I have to go to the Hospital I am at High Risk due to my blood pressure being so high & being upset all the time...hopefully my baby is okay
I am too for the same thing I am almost 32wks, good luck I hope you feel better soon!
Thank you I hope you feel better as well sprmom87

Headaches combined with swollen hands and high blood pressure are signs of preeclampsia. I would defiantly call Dr. I have high bp, headaches  and swelling and am on bed rest to try to prevent preeclampsia from coming full blown. Hope you feel better. Its no fun I know.
Based on your symptoms, it sounds like you have preeclempsia-call/go to your doctor.

question: I will be 35 weeks tomorrow with my first child & i've been vomiting, have a migrane, couldn't sleep lastnight & still cant, hands been swollen, vagina hurts when I sit up or get out of bed & my body feels very weak has anyone been thru this? I drink plenty water & keep my feet up
title: can someone figure this out for me?
